alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 19 at 2:48PM MDT until April 20 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ..RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 10 PM MDT TODAY FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR MUCH OF CENTRAL, EAST CENTRAL AND NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN AND NORTH CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... .Windy conditions will persist through early evening, keeping the threat of critical fire weather conditions going. Temperatures will drop and cool overnight, but humidity will be unable to recover very efficiently with many zones struggling to reach 25 to 35 percent by Thursday morning. Going into the afternoon Thursday, windy conditions will redevelop with very dry air invading the area. This along with another round of unstable conditions will lead to more critical conditions Thursday afternoon, namely across central, east central and northeastern areas of New Mexico. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Central Highlands (Zone 125), and East Central Plains (Zone 126) until 10 PM MDT today and again on Thursday from noon to 8 pm MDT. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph today. Northwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph Thursday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Dropping to 6 to 10 percent late today and around 6 to 12 percent Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
